workflow.name: Transform RSS feeds into blog articles with GPT-4, human review & Google Docs
workflow.description:
[Workflow Overview]
![CleanShot 20251030 at 17.35.492x.png](fileId:3143)
‚ö†Ô∏è **Self-Hosted Only**: This workflow uses the gotoHuman community node and requires a self-hosted n8n instance.

## Who's It For
Content teams, bloggers, news websites, and marketing agencies who want to automate content creation from RSS feeds while maintaining editorial quality control. Perfect for anyone who needs to transform news articles into detailed blog posts at scale.

## What It Does
This workflow automatically converts RSS feed articles into comprehensive, SEO-optimized blog posts using AI. It fetches articles from your RSS source, generates detailed content with GPT-4, sends drafts for human review via gotoHuman, and publishes approved articles to Google Docs with automatic Slack notifications to your team.

## How It Works
1. Schedule Trigger runs every 6 hours to check for new RSS articles
2. RSS Read node fetches the latest articles from your feed
3. Format RSS Data extracts key information (title, keywords, description)
4. Generate Article with AI creates a structured blog post using OpenAI GPT-4
5. Structure Article Data formats the content with metadata
6. Request Human Review sends the article for approval via gotoHuman
7. Check Approval Status routes the workflow based on review decision
8. Create Google Doc and Add Article Content publish approved articles
9. Send Slack Notification alerts your team with article details

## Requirements
- **OpenAI API key** with GPT-4 access
- **Google account** for Google Docs integration
- **gotoHuman account** for human-in-the-loop approval workflow
- **Slack workspace** for team notifications
- **RSS feed URL** from your preferred source

## How to Set Up
1. **Configure RSS Feed**: In the "RSS Read" node, replace the example URL with your RSS feed source
2. **Connect OpenAI**: Add your OpenAI API credentials to the "OpenAI Chat Model" node
3. **Set Up Google Docs**: Connect your Google account and optionally specify a folder ID for organized storage
4. **Configure gotoHuman**: Add your gotoHuman credentials and create a review template for article approval
5. **Connect Slack**: Authenticate with Slack and select the channel for notifications
6. **Customize Content**: Modify the AI prompt in "Generate Article with AI" to match your brand voice and article structure
7. **Adjust Schedule**: Change the trigger frequency in "Schedule Trigger" based on your content needs

## How to Customize
- **Article Style**: Edit the AI prompt to change tone, length, or structure
- **Keywords & SEO**: Modify the "Format RSS Data" node to adjust keyword extraction logic
- **Publishing Destination**: Change from Google Docs to other platforms (WordPress, Notion, etc.)
- **Approval Workflow**: Customize the gotoHuman template to include specific review criteria
- **Notification Format**: Adjust the Slack message template to include additional metadata
- **Processing Volume**: Modify the Code node to process multiple RSS articles instead of just one

workflow.name: Generate blog articles from RSS feeds with AI review

parameters.content:
## üì∞ RSS to Blog Article Generator with Human Approval

### What This Workflow Does
Automatically converts RSS feed articles into detailed blog posts using AI, sends them for human review, and publishes approved articles to Google Docs with Slack notifications.

### How It Works
1. **Schedule Trigger** - Runs every 6 hours to check for new articles
2. **RSS Feed** - Fetches latest articles from your RSS source
3. **Data Processing** - Extracts key information (title, keywords, description)
4. **AI Generation** - Creates detailed blog post using GPT-4
5. **Human Review** - Sends article to reviewer via gotoHuman
6. **Approval Check** - Routes approved/rejected articles
7. **Google Docs** - Creates document with approved content
8. **Slack Notification** - Alerts team of published article

### Setup Requirements
- OpenAI API key (GPT-4 access)
- Google Docs account
- gotoHuman account (for human-in-the-loop approval)
- Slack workspace (for notifications)
- RSS feed URL

### Customization
- Change RSS feed URL in "RSS Read" node
- Adjust article length, tone, and keywords in "Format RSS Data" node
- Modify AI prompt in "Generate Article with AI" node
- Configure approval template in gotoHuman node
- Set schedule frequency in "Schedule Trigger" node

### Target Users
Content teams, bloggers, news sites, marketing agencies who want to automate content creation while maintaining quality control.

### 1Ô∏è‚É£ Scheduled Trigger
Runs workflow every 6 hours to check for new RSS articles. Adjust the interval based on your content needs.

### 2Ô∏è‚É£ Fetch RSS Feed
Reads articles from your RSS feed. Replace the URL with your own RSS feed source.

### 3Ô∏è‚É£ Process Data
Extracts title, keywords, and description from RSS feed. Formats data for AI processing.

### 4Ô∏è‚É£ AI Article Generation
Uses OpenAI to generate a detailed, structured blog article based on RSS content.

### 5Ô∏è‚É£ Format Article Data
Structures the AI-generated content with title, body, metadata, and word count.

### 6Ô∏è‚É£ Human Review Request
Sends article to designated reviewer via gotoHuman. Waits for approval/rejection.

### 7Ô∏è‚É£ Approval Check
Routes workflow based on review decision. Approved articles proceed to publishing.

### 8Ô∏è‚É£ Publish to Google Docs
Creates new Google Doc with article title and content, including metadata.

### 9Ô∏è‚É£ Team Notification
Sends formatted message to Slack with article details and approval information.

parameters.text:
=You are a professional content writer. Based on the following news article, create a detailed and engaging blog post.

„ÄêSource Article„Äë
Title: {{ $json.original_title }}
Summary: {{ $json.original_description }}
Source URL: {{ $json.original_url }}

„ÄêWriting Requirements„Äë
- Topic: {{ $json.topic }}
- Keywords: {{ $json.keywords }}
- Target length: {{ $json.target_length }}
- Tone: {{ $json.tone }}

„ÄêArticle Structure„Äë
Please create the article with the following structure:

# Compelling Title (specific and engaging)

## Introduction (200 words)
- Background of this news
- Why it matters

## Detailed Analysis
### Point 1: Overview
- What happened

### Point 2: Impact
- What are the implications

### Point 3: Future Outlook
- What's next

## Summary (150 words)
- Key takeaways

---
Meta Description (120 characters max)

options.systemMessage: You are a professional content writer who creates valuable, detailed articles based on news sources.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
